title: Capturing electronic patient reported outcomes in oncology practice. - ASCO Publications

summary.text: **KEY FINDING**: 67% of patients completed assessments, reducing discontinuation risk by 30%.
**TACTICAL WIN [SHIP NOW]**: Integrate AI-driven reminders to optimize patient engagement and completion rates.
**MARKET SIGNAL [ðŸŸ¡ NOTABLE]**: Increasing demand for PRO data in oncology trials to meet regulatory standards.
**CONCERN**: Self-selection bias may skew results toward healthier patients, affecting clinical validity.

title: Patient-Reported Outcomes in Older Adults With Transthyretin Amyloid Cardiomyopathy - JACC

summary.text: **KEY FINDING**: EQ-5D-5 L and MLHFQ predict all-cause mortality and HF-related hospitalization in ATTR-CM.
**TACTICAL WIN [ROADMAP]**: Develop ePRO platforms with adaptive questionnaires to capture PROs efficiently.
**MARKET SIGNAL [ðŸŸ¡ NOTABLE]**: FDA prioritizing PRO data for accelerated approval of rare diseases like ATTR-CM.
**CONCERN**: Baseline differences between trial populations may limit direct comparison of PRO outcomes.

title: Patient-Reported Symptom Assessment and Early Chemotherapy Discontinuation in ... - medRxiv

summary.text: **KEY FINDING**: 67% of GI cancer patients completed assessments, lowering early discontinuation risk by ~30%, with consistent results across prognostic groups.
**TACTICAL WIN [SHIP NOW]**: Automate day-3 reminders to improve symptom assessment completion rates among patients.
**MARKET SIGNAL [ðŸ”´ URGENT]**: FDA now mandates PRO data in trials within 12 months, emphasizing clinical validity of patient-reported outcomes.
**CONCERN**: Study limited by self-selection bias; healthier patients may complete assessments more frequently.
